title: "The report system doesn't work" - Why that's a GOOD thing.
body:
The report system is there to identify hateful, spiteful, people who get some strange kick out of insulting strangers on the internet.

It is NOT there for you to blame your teammates because you lost.  You lose games.  Pros lose games.  Even Faker lost a game.  Every single game, one team is going to lose.  There are always losers.  Sometimes, it is your turn.

The reason the report system "doesn't work" is that toxic players are the ones most eager to report their teammates.  If the report system actually banned every player who got reported, there would be nothing but toxic players in LoL for a while, then there would be no one left at all.

Stop treating the report system like it's your own personal griefing tool.  Learn to play better, or just learn that no matter how good you play, and how skilled or unskilled your teammates are, you WILL lose games anyway.

One of my friends worked as a dispatcher for 911 (emergency help line in the USA for you non-Americans).  She said it's a big problem getting help to people in time because 911 gets a lot of phony, prank, or otherwise unimportant phone calls.

If people actually used the report system the way it was intended, it would be a lot easier for Riot to keep the real hateful, spliteful  immature people out of this game.

You get the chat logs for the games that triggered your suspension, but you would have had to be reported it a higher than average percentage of games before you actually got bumped up to a 2 week suspension.

The reform card is sent to the email address that is registered to your account. If you don't see it in your inbox, check the junk mail folder. The chat logs are typically the main thing that is sent to you, and it's usually logs from the last few games you were reported in. Typically, unless you said nothing in any of the games, it would be the entire chat log with the things that you have said. It would also tell you what rule was broken, it might not have been because of verbal abuse.

If you are concerned about your ban, want clarification, and don't want to publicly share your chat logs, you can [submit a ticket directly to Riot at this link](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new).

Even though I sometimes tilt ingame I never intentionally feed, troll, assist the enemy team, flame or use any kind of offensive language worse than wtf. I never was banned, chat restricted or anything and I personally know lots of people who are like "Why did I get chat restricted/banned? I didn't do anything.". In 90% of the cases they'd still be somewhat toxic by showing negative attitude, fighting in the chat all time or just giving up after 2-3 kills on the enemy team and stop playing properly. 
I'm pretty sure that I already received so many unjust reports that if it was true what you're saying I should already have a lifetime ban.
Before you write something in chat because you've got a feeder or troll don't let him make you use offensive language or go on a heavy flame streak, you'll just end up getting caught by the troll and in the end you may receive an actually just report even though in your perception you did nothing wrong.
Teammates fucking up will never be a reason to act just like them or start flaming.

Of course I don't know your special case, but I've been playing this game since November 2009 and I've never got banned or anything. Stay positive, stay calm and even if you rage it's better to just throw things through your room than showing this ingame (when I'm really pissed off I just rage in real-life, helps alot better than firing up the douchebags in your team anyways^^).

wait, so you mean to say I can flame my teammates and they wont get banned. WTF Rito.

On the one hand you make some good points. It's sad that the report system has (or had, I can't remember if the new one has it) a section for bad play just because Riot knows that people are going to report for someone just not being very good at the game and this way they're lumped into one place.

That said, it is very frustrating for those of us that report for legitimate reasons and still end up in games with the same rude players exhibiting the same toxic behavior, or more often in my case script users that aren't even actually even playing.

I don't think you, or any player, should assume they know WHY the system is there.  It's actually quite insulting that you insinuate that people are hateful or just trying to get a kick out of things.  Mainly I see peoples frustration in a game out come and let their words descend into madness because they lack the ability to properly communicate (and quickly) what they need out of the other person in a way that's fair to both and contributing to the same goal

That's something to keep in mind the next time you're in a game or want to post something that's not actually helping anyone.

Personally, I think there should be a system to "report" inexperienced players and a huge focus should go into helping these players learn.  

Many people don't understand things that should be basic like when to dragon, how to tower dive, where to stand and how to get to a team fight, how to set up a 4 man gank at bot or even more basic like csing properly, not dying more than 10 times a game (because anything more means you seriously made mistakes), and how to freeze a lane when behind.

The best things I've seen (from my experience) have been youtube videos of "how to recall effectively" or "the trading stance" (positioning for csing).

Frankly, complaining about how people abuse a system and asking them to stop doesn't work. The system has to be fixed, and the ONLY credit I give Riot is that they are continually "fixing" it.

Pretty sure that's not a good point. If the report system worked correctly, then it would just ignore the toxic person's bans and punish the toxic people. The difference between the report system and 911 services is that the reports are sent through an automated system. Right now it already ignore's the random bans because there's no reason to punish unless they flamed too.

So by your logic, even if Malphite fed 14 kills, or Katarina thought she was a god with only 2 items 30 minutes in, or your jungler decided to try jungle Karthus, you shouldn't report them for being unskilled?

Or how bout if your twitchy Lee-Sin starts going off after a failed game, f this f that. Or how bout if say Garen starts spitting some venom at the bot lane, calling the Vayne a product of incest or something. He shouldn't get reported for verbal harassment?

There is a reason that there is a report button, and I don't care if you've lost 5 games in a row, or this is your first loss of the day. Stuff like that should be reported, regardless of the reason.

I'll accept the loss, get over it, and move the hell on with my life. If we lost but no-one is really to blame, then I won't report anyone because it would be just any other game of League.
